paragraphs.text: The key concept to understand here is that with GraphQL, your API schema and your database schemas are decoupled. In other words, there might not be any author and commentsCount fields in our database, but we can “simulate” them through the power of resolvers.
GraphQL was made by Facebook, and I don’t trust Facebook
paragraphs.name: 9e94

78b38c385805.title:
So much fuzz around GraphQL, 
in the nutshell it is similar to 
the XML document validated against…

paragraphs.text:
So much fuzz around GraphQL, 
in the nutshell it is similar to 
the XML document validated against a DTD or XML Schema, 
augmented by circular references . 
Or considering JSON it is like MongoDB Aggregation .
paragraphs.name: 38d6

paragraphs.text: yet another sublanguage? yet another bunch of idiosyncratic syntax to learn and forget over the next 3 year ecosystem churn thing? really? aren’t there enough to choose from already?
why couldn’t it be a library with regular oo, class or prototype bindings for languages / environments that people care about?

616c42309cbe.title: As a mobile developper I finally found peace moving from REST to GraphQL.

paragraphs.text: As a mobile developper I finally found peace moving from REST to GraphQL. Also with GraphQL backend services I move really fast. I’m currently using Graphcool and it helped me a lot with my backend and with learning GraphQL at the same time. Honestly, I’m still amazed how fast I managed to set up the main schema and client requests with it. I don’t even want to come back to REST anymore…

paragraphs.text: import time
paragraphs.name: 4d30

paragraphs.text:
good = “monolothic”
bad = “decentralized”
paragraphs.name: f630

paragraphs.text:
while True:
 \t\t print(“We can free ourselves from the failures of “ + bad + “ architecture by implementing “ + good + “ architecture!”)
\t\t time.sleep(157788000)
\t\t good, bad = bad, good
paragraphs.name: 7dd6

9dee3a1e8576.title: Something not emphasized enough is the developer convenience of introspection and self…

paragraphs.text: Something not emphasized enough is the developer convenience of introspection and self-documentation, which is built into the spec. As you build your types and you document that code, it automatically becomes information available to the client coder through introspection with tools like GraphiQL. That is a huge time saver for the devs building the…
